title: Drawing, Representation of Apollo, ca. 1590
medium: Brown ink and wash on paper, laid
inscribed: Inscribed in upper left near upper center: Apollo
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Obverse: Apollo seated under a tree with a violin. Around him are symbols of the Arts, below two buildings in theTuscan style, a formal garden and a fountain. Reverse: Upper section: The hunters on horseback lasso a stag, related to "Venationes" 31. Lower section: Wolves attacking bulls. Foxes attack young calves, goats related to "Venationes" 48. Source: Welmoet van Kannerbok [sp?]

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Representation of Apollo, ca. 1590. Brown ink and wash on paper, laid. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2661
